sen.j: 鮎川 義介（あゆかわ よしすけ、1880年（明治13年）11月6日 - 1967年（昭和42年）2月13日）は、日本の実業家、政治家。
sen.e: Yoshisuke AYUKAWA (November 6, 1880 to February 13, 1967) was a Japanese entrepreneur and statesman.
Yoshisuke AYUKAWA (November 6, 1880 to February 13, 1967) was a Japanese entrepreneur and statesman.
Yoshisuke AYUKAWA (November 6, 1880 to February 13, 1967) was a Japanese entrepreneur and statesman.

sen.j: 日産コンツェルンの創始者。
sen.e: The founder of Nissan Konzern Company Group.
The founder of Nissan Konzern Company Group.
The founder of Nissan Konzern Company Group.

sen.j: ※通称名で「あいかわ よしすけ」と呼ばれることもあるが、本名は「あゆかわ よしすけ」である。
sen.e: *He is sometimes called by his common name, "Yoshisuke AIKAWA", but his real name is Yoshisuke AIKAWA.
*He is sometimes called by his common name, 'Yoshisuke AIKAWA', but his real name is Yoshisuke AYUKAWA.
sen.cmt: ダブルクォーテーションをシングルに、最後のAIKAWAをAYUKAWAにしました。
sen.e: *He is sometimes called by his common name, 'Yoshisuke AIKAWA', but his real name is Yoshisuke AYUKAWA.

sen.j: 1880年（明治13年、0歳）、明治時代の元勲井上馨の実姉の長女を母とし、旧長州藩武士鮎川弥八（第10代当主）を父として、山口県氷川郡大内村（現在の山口市大内地区）に生れた。
sen.e: In 1880 (at the age of 0), he was born to the eldest daughter of the real sister of Kaoru INOUE, Genkun (the statesmen who contributed in Meiji Restoration), and Yahachi AYUKAWA, a former samurai of Choshu Domain (the 10th famil head), in Ouchi Village, Hikawa County, Yamaguchi Prefecture (present day Ouchi area, Yamaguchi City).

In 1880 (at the age of 0), he was born to the eldest daughter of the real sister of Kaoru INOUE, Genkun (the statesmen who contributed in the Meiji Period), and Yahachi AYUKAWA, a former samurai of Choshu Domain (the 10th family head), in Ouchi Village, Hikawa County, Yamaguchi Prefecture (present day Ouchi area, Yamaguchi City).
sen.cmt: Meiji Restoration をthe Meiji Periodに、familをfamilyにしました。
sen.e: In 1880 (at the age of 0), he was born to the eldest daughter of the real sister of Kaoru INOUE, Genkun (the statesmen who contributed in the Meiji Period), and Yahachi AYUKAWA, a former samurai of Choshu Domain (the 10th family head), in Ouchi Village, Hikawa County, Yamaguchi Prefecture (present day Ouchi area, Yamaguchi City).

sen.j: 山口高等学校 (旧制)を経て、1903年（明治36年、23歳）に東京大学工科大学機械科を卒業。
sen.e: He studied at Yamaguchi High School (the old system) and graduated from the Department of Mechanics of the University of Tokyo in 1903 (at the age of 23).
He studied at Yamaguchi High School (the old system) and graduated from the Department of Mechanics of the University of Tokyo in 1903 (at the age of 23).
He studied at Yamaguchi High School (the old system) and graduated from the Department of Mechanics of the University of Tokyo in 1903 (at the age of 23).

sen.j: 東芝に入社。
sen.e: He entered Toshiba.
He entered Toshiba.
He entered Toshiba.

sen.j: 身分を明かさない条件で日給48銭の職工となる。
sen.e: He became a mechanic at 48 sen per day under the condition that his noble birth would remain hidden.
He became a mechanic with a daily wage of 48 sen under the condition that his noble birth would remain hidden.
He became a mechanic with a daily wage of 48 sen under the condition that his noble birth would remain hidden.

sen.j: その後､当時の技術はすべて西欧の模倣であったので、西欧の状況を体験すべく渡米。
sen.e: Later, he moved to the US in order to have experience of the Western situation, since all the technology those days were imitations of the Western technology.
Later, he moved to the US in order to have experience of the Western situation, since all the technology those days were imitations of the Western technology.
Later, he moved to the US in order to have experience of the Western situation, since all the technology those days were imitations of the Western technology.

sen.j: 約1年強を可鍛鋳鉄工場（グルド・カプラー社）で労務者として働く。
sen.e: He worked for a malleable cast iron factory (the Gould Coupler Company) as a laborer for more than a year.
He worked for a malleable cast iron factory (the Gould Coupler Company) as a laborer for more than a year.
He worked for a malleable cast iron factory (the Gould Coupler Company) as a laborer for more than a year.

sen.j: 1909年（明治42年、29歳）、井上馨の支援を受けて戸畑鋳物（現日立金属）を創立。
sen.e: In 1909 (at the age of 29), he founded Tobata Casting Company (present Hitachi Metal Company) with the support of Kaoru INOUE.
In 1909 (at the age of 29), he founded Tobata Casting Company (present Hitachi Metals, Ltd.) with the support of Kaoru INOUE.
sen.cmt: Hitachi Metal CompanyをHitachi Metals, Ltd.としました。
sen.e: In 1909 (at the age of 29), he founded Tobata Casting Company (present Hitachi Metals, Ltd.) with the support of Kaoru INOUE.

sen.j: 1928年（昭和3年、48歳）、久原鉱業の社長に就任し、同社を日本産業（日産）と改称。
sen.e: In 1928 (at the age of 48), he became the president of of the Kuhara Mining Company and changed the name of the company to Nihon Sangyo (Nissan).
In 1928 (at the age of 48), he became the president of of the Kuhara Mining Company and changed the name of the company to Nihon Sangyo (Nissan).
In 1928 (at the age of 48), he became the president of of the Kuhara Mining Company and changed the name of the company to Nihon Sangyo (Nissan).

sen.j: 義弟久原房之助の経営する久原鉱業は、当時は、第一次世界大戦後の恐慌と久原の政界入りで経営破綻に瀕していたが、政友会の田中義一（陸軍大将）らの再建の懇請にしぶしぶ応じたもの。
sen.e: The Kuhara Mining Company managed by his brother-in-law, Fusanosuke KUHARA, was on the verge of bankruptcy due to the economic depression after the World War I and KUHARA's entrance into politics, so AYUKAWA reluctantly agreed to take over the position at the request from Giichi TANAKA (Army General) of the Seiyu Party and others, who wished for reconstruction of the company.

The Kuhara Mining Company managed by his younger brother-in-law, Fusanosuke KUHARA, was on the verge of bankruptcy due to the economic depression after the World War I and KUHARA's entrance into politics, so AYUKAWA reluctantly agreed to take over the position at the request from Giichi TANAKA (Army General) of the Seiyu Party and others, who wished for reconstruction of the company.
sen.cmt: brotherの前にyoungerを追加しました。
sen.e: The Kuhara Mining Company managed by his younger brother-in-law, Fusanosuke KUHARA, was on the verge of bankruptcy due to the economic depression after the World War I and KUHARA's entrance into politics, so AYUKAWA reluctantly agreed to take over the position at the request from Giichi TANAKA (Army General) of the Seiyu Party and others, who wished for reconstruction of the company.

sen.j: 会社を持株会社に変更し、公開持株会社として傘下に、日産自動車、日本鉱業、日立製作所、日産化学、日本油脂、ニチレイ、日本炭鉱、日産火災、日産生命など多数の企業を収め、日産コンツェルンを形成。
sen.e: He changed the company into a holding company, and created Nissan Konzern Company Group, which includes Nisan Motors, Nippon Mining, Hitachi, Nissan Chemicals, Nichiyu, Nichirei Corporation, Japan Coal Mine, Nissan Fire Insurance, Nissan Mutual Life Insurance and others.

He changed the company into a holding company, and created Nissan Konzern Company Group, which owned many publicly held holding companies such as Nissan Motors, Nippon Mining, Hitachi, Nissan Chemicals, Nichiyu, Nichirei Corporation, Japan Coal Mine, Nissan Fire Insurance and Nissan Mutual Life Insurance.
sen.cmt: 「公開持株会社として傘下に」および「多数の企業」が訳抜けです。Nisan MotorsをNissan Motorsにincludesをowned とした他、訳抜け部分を追加するべく書き換えました。
sen.e: He changed the company into a holding company, and created Nissan Konzern Company Group, which owned many publicly held holding companies such as Nissan Motors, Nippon Mining, Hitachi, Nissan Chemicals, Nichiyu, Nichirei Corporation, Japan Coal Mine, Nissan Fire Insurance and Nissan Mutual Life Insurance.

sen.j: 1933年（昭和8年、53歳）、自動車工業株式会社（現在のいすゞ自動車）よりダットサンの製造権を無償で譲り受け、同年12月ダットサンの製造のために自動車製造株式会社を設立する。
sen.e: In 1933 (at the age of 53), he took over the production rights for the Datsun from Automobile Industries Company (present Isuzu Mortors) for free, and in December, 1933, he founded Jidosha Seizo Company for the production of Datsun.

In 1933 (at the age of 53), he took over the production rights for the Datsun from Automobile Industries Company (present Isuzu Mortors) for free, and in December, 1933, he founded Jidosha Seizo Company for the production of Datsun.

In 1933 (at the age of 53), he took over the production rights for the Datsun from Automobile Industries Company (present Isuzu Mortors) for free, and in December, 1933, he founded Jidosha Seizo Company for the production of Datsun.

sen.j: 1934年（昭和9年、54歳）、自動車製造株式会社を日産自動車製造株式会社と改称。
sen.e: In 1934 (at the age of 54), he changed the name of Jidosha Seizo Company to Nissan Motor Company.
In 1934 (at the age of 54), he changed the name of Jidosha Seizo Company to Nissan Motor Co., Ltd.
sen.cmt: 最後のCompanyをCo., Ltdとしました。
sen.e: In 1934 (at the age of 54), he changed the name of Jidosha Seizo Company to Nissan Motor Co., Ltd.

sen.j: 1937年（昭和12年、57歳）、日産を満州国に移し、満州重工業開発株式会社として初代総裁・相談役に就任。
sen.e: In 1937 (at the age of 57), he moved Nissan to Manchuria became the first president and consultant of the Manchurian Industrial Development Company.
In 1937 (at the age of 57), he moved Nissan to Manchuria and became the first president and consultant of the Manchurian Industrial Development Company.
sen.cmt: became の前にandを追加しました。
sen.e: In 1937 (at the age of 57), he moved Nissan to Manchuria and became the first president and consultant of the Manchurian Industrial Development Company.

sen.j: 同時に満州国顧問、貴族院勅撰議員、内閣顧問を兼務した。
sen.e: At the same time he had the positions of an advisor of Manchukuo, a councilor of the House of Peers at th eImperial command, and an advisor of the Cabinet.
At the same time he had the positions of an advisor of Manchukuo, a councilor of the House of Peers at the Imperial command, and an advisor of the Cabinet.
sen.cmt: at th eImperial を at the Imperial としました。
sen.e: At the same time he had the positions of an advisor of Manchukuo, a councilor of the House of Peers at the Imperial command, and an advisor of the Cabinet.

sen.j: 当時の満州国の軍・官・財界の実力者5人の弐キ参スケの1人とされた。
sen.e: He was considered as one of "Nikisansuke", which consisted of 5 leaders in military, government, and finance in Manchukuo.
He was one of the five leaders called 'Nikisansuke,' who were considered as influential in the worlds of military, government, and business in Manchukuo at that time.
sen.cmt: 「当時の」訳抜けのためat that time を文末に追加した他、全文を書き換えました。
sen.e: He was one of the five leaders called 'Nikisansuke,' who were considered as influential in the worlds of military, government, and business in Manchukuo at that time.

sen.j: 1939年（昭和14年、59歳）頃には白洲次郎らと世界情勢を語り合い、ドイツと英仏間の戦争は、英仏の勝利との結論を得る。
sen.e: In about 1939 (at the age of 59), he discussed the world politics with Jiro SHIRASU, and concluded that the war between Germany and England and France would end in the victory of England and France.

Around 1939 (at the age of 59), he discussed the world politics with Jiro SHIRASU and others, and concluded that the war between Germany and England and France would end in the victory of England and France.
sen.cmt: In aboutをAroundとし、SHIRASUの後にand othersを追加しました。
sen.e: Around 1939 (at the age of 59), he discussed the world politics with Jiro SHIRASU and others, and concluded that the war between Germany and England and France would end in the victory of England and France.

sen.j: 関東軍との関係悪化から日産グループの満州撤退を検討。
sen.e: He considered Nissan Group's withdrawal from Manchukuo due to the deterioraion of the relationship with Kwantung Army (Japanese armed forces in Manchukuo).
He considered Nissan Group's withdrawal from Manchukuo due to the deterioraion of the relationship with Kwantung Army (Japanese armed forces in Manchukuo).
He considered Nissan Group's withdrawal from Manchukuo due to the deterioraion of the relationship with Kwantung Army (Japanese armed forces in Manchukuo).

sen.j: 1942年（昭和17年）頃に満州重工業開発の総裁を辞任。
sen.e: In about 1942, he resigned from the president of the Manchurian Industrial Development Company.
Around 1942, he resigned from the president of the Manchurian Industrial Development Company.
Around 1942, he resigned from the president of the Manchurian Industrial Development Company.

sen.j: 1943年（昭和18年、63歳）：11月17日に藤原銀次郎が東條内閣に入閣すると、五島慶太、鈴木貞一らと内閣顧問に就任。
sen.e: In 1943 (at the age of 63): On November 17, when Ginjiro FUJIWARA became a member of the Tojo Cabinet, AYUKAWA took the position of an advisor of the cabinet along with Keita GOTO and Teiichi SUZUKI.

In 1943 (at the age of 63): On November 17, when Ginjiro FUJIWARA became a member of the Tojo Cabinet, AYUKAWA took the position of an advisor of the Cabinet along with Keita GOTO and Teiichi SUZUKI..
sen.cmt: 最終行のcabinetを大文字で始めました。ピリオドを追加しました。
sen.e: In 1943 (at the age of 63): On November 17, when Ginjiro FUJIWARA became a member of the Tojo Cabinet, AYUKAWA took the position of an advisor of the Cabinet along with Keita GOTO and Teiichi SUZUKI..

sen.j: 第二次世界大戦終結後、戦争犯罪容疑を受け1945年12月に逮捕され巣鴨拘置所に20か月拘置されたが、容疑が晴れる。
sen.e: After the World War II ended, he was charged with war crime and got arrested in December, 1945, and incarcerated in Sugamo Prision for 20 months, but he was cleared of the charge.
After the World War II ended, he was charged with war crime and got arrested in December, 1945, and incarcerated in Sugamo Prision for 20 months, but he was cleared of the charge.
After the World War II ended, he was charged with war crime and got arrested in December, 1945, and incarcerated in Sugamo Prision for 20 months, but he was cleared of the charge.

sen.j: 獄中にて日本の復興策を練る。
sen.e: In jail, he reflected on how to restore Japan from the damage.
In jail, he reflected on how to restore Japan from the damage.
In jail, he reflected on how to restore Japan from the damage.

sen.j: 1952年（昭和27年、72歳）、日産グループ各社の出資を得て中小企業助成会を設立。
sen.e: In 1952 (at the age of 72), he founded the Small and Medium-Sized Firms Assistance Association with the invenstment of the companies of Nissan Group.
In 1952 (at the age of 72), he founded the Small and Medium-Sized Firms Assistance Association with the invenstment of the companies of Nissan Group.
In 1952 (at the age of 72), he founded the Small and Medium-Sized Firms Assistance Association with the invenstment of the companies of Nissan Group.

sen.j: 会長に就任。
sen.e: He became the chairman.
He became the chairman.
He became the chairman.

sen.j: 以後、中小企業の振興に尽力。
sen.e: After this, he worked hard for the restoration of small and medium-sized firms.
After this, he worked hard for the restoration of small and medium-sized firms.
After this, he worked hard for the restoration of small and medium-sized firms.

sen.j: 1953年（昭和28年、73歳）、帝国石油社長、石油資源開発社長。
sen.e: In 1953 (at the age of 73), he became the presidents ofTeikoku Oil Company and of Japan Petroleum Exploration Company.
In 1953 (at the age of 73), he became the presidents of Teikoku Oil Co., Ltd. and of Japan Petroleum Exploration Co., Ltd.
sen.cmt: ofとTeikokuの間にスペースを挿入しました・CompanyをCo., Ltd.に変更しました。
sen.e: In 1953 (at the age of 73), he became the presidents of Teikoku Oil Co., Ltd. and of Japan Petroleum Exploration Co., Ltd.

sen.j: 参議院議員に当選。
sen.e: He was elected to become a member of the House of Councilors of the Diet of Japan.
He was elected as a member of the House of Councilors of the Diet.
sen.cmt: to become をasに変更しました。文末のof Japanを削除しました(the Dietだけで日本の議会であることがわかります。）
sen.e: He was elected as a member of the House of Councilors of the Diet.

sen.j: 1956年（昭和31年、76歳）、日本中小企業政治連盟（中政連）を創立し、総裁に就任。
sen.e: In 1956 (at the age of 76), he founded the Japan Medium and Small Enterprise Political Federation (Chuseiren) and became the president.
In 1956 (at the age of 76), he founded the Japan Medium and Small Enterprise Political Federation (Chuseiren) and became the president.
In 1956 (at the age of 76), he founded the Japan Medium and Small Enterprise Political Federation (Chuseiren) and became the president.

sen.j: その後主として政治家としての晩年を送る。
sen.e: After that he lived as a statesman until he died.
After that he lived as a statesman until he died.
After that he lived as a statesman until he died.

sen.j: また同年設立された全国中小企業団体中央会の会長にも就く。
sen.e: In 1956, he also became the chairman of the All Japan Small and Medium-Sized Enterprises Association.
Also, he took the position of chairman of the National Federation of Small Business Associations established in the same year.
sen.cmt: 「全国中小企業団体中央会」の英文訳を変更しました。また、ここで、「同年」は「設立された」を修飾するものであって全文にかけるものではないようなので、全文を書き換えました。
sen.e: Also, he took the position of chairman of the National Federation of Small Business Associations established in the same year.

sen.j: この間、岸内閣経済最高顧問、東洋大学名誉総長。
sen.e: During this time, he was the supreme advisor of economics for the Kishi Cabinet and the honorary president ot Toyo University.
During this time, he was the supreme advisor of economics for the Kishi Cabinet and the honorary president ot Toyo University.
During this time, he was the supreme advisor of economics for the Kishi Cabinet and the honorary president ot Toyo University.

sen.j: 産業計画会議委員（議長・松永安左エ門）就任。
sen.e: He became a member of Sangyo Keikaku Kaigi (Industry Planning Board) (the chairman, Anzaemon MATSUNAGA).
He became a member of Sangyo Keikaku Kaigi (Industry Planning Board) (the chairman, Yasuzaemon MATSUNAGA).
He became a member of Sangyo Keikaku Kaigi (Industry Planning Board) (the chairman, Yasuzaemon MATSUNAGA).

sen.j: 1959年（昭和34年、79歳）、全国区より参議院に再度当選したが、同時に当選した次男鮎川金次郎派運動員の選挙違反容疑が高まり、12月に責任をとり議員辞職。
sen.e: In 1959 (at the age of 79), he was reelected to be a member of the House of Councilors, but since one of the supporters of his second son, Kinjiro AYUKAWA, who was also elected, was suspected of election violations, AYUKAWA took the responsibility and resigned in December.

In 1959 (at the age of 79), although he was reelected as a member of the House of Councilors from the nationwide constituency, he resigned from the Diet in December of the same year, taking the responsibility for highly-suspected election violations by campaigners for his second son Kinjiro AYUKAWA who was also elected in the same election.
sen.cmt: 「全国区より」「同時に」訳抜け 全文書換えました。
sen.e: In 1959 (at the age of 79), although he was reelected as a member of the House of Councilors from the nationwide constituency, he resigned from the Diet in December of the same year, taking the responsibility for highly-suspected election violations by campaigners for his second son Kinjiro AYUKAWA who was also elected in the same election.

sen.j: 1966年（昭和41年、86歳）、持病の胆嚢炎を手術したが、高齢により回復がはかどらず入院が長引く。
sen.e: In 1966 (at the age of 86), he underwent an operation for his chronic disease, gall bladder inflammation, but it took time for him to recover because of his old age.

In 1966 (at the age of 86), although he underwent an operation for his chronic disease, gallbladder inflammation, his recovery was very slow because of his old age and his stay in hospital was prolonged.
sen.cmt: 回復できたかのようなニュアンスがあるので全文書き直しとしました。また、gall bladderのスペースを削除しました。。
sen.e: In 1966 (at the age of 86), although he underwent an operation for his chronic disease, gallbladder inflammation, his recovery was very slow because of his old age and his stay in hospital was prolonged.

sen.j: 1967年（昭和42年）2月13日、合併症による急性肺炎により駿河台杏雲堂病院にて死去。
sen.e: On February 13, in 1967, he died of acute pneumonia as a result of complications at the Surugadai Kyoundo Hospital.
On February 13, 1967, he died of acute pneumonia occuring as a complication at Surugadai Kyoundo Hospital.
sen.cmt: in およびresult ofを削除しました。Surugadaiの前のtheを削除しました。Complication を単数形にしました。
sen.e: On February 13, 1967, he died of acute pneumonia occuring as a complication at Surugadai Kyoundo Hospital.

sen.j: 享年86。
sen.e: at the age of 86.
He died at the age of 86.
sen.cmt: He died を追加しました。
sen.e: He died at the age of 86.

sen.j: 父：鮎川弥八（長州藩武士）
sen.e: Father: Yahachi AYUKAWA (samurai of Choshu Domain)
Father: Yahachi AYUKAWA (samurai of Choshu Domain)

sen.j: 母：ナカ

Mother: Naka

sen.j: 大叔父：井上馨（長州藩士､政治家）
sen.e: Grand-uncle: Kaoru INOUE (feudal retainer of Choshu Domain, statesman)

sen.e: Elder sister: Sumi (Adopted mother of Masahiko KIMURA, shizoku (family or person with samurai ancestors) in Kochi Prefecture)

sen.e: Younger sister: Kiyo (married to Fusanosuke KUHARA, an entrepreneur and statesman, in Yamaguchi Prefecture)

sen.j: 妹：フジ（福岡県、実業家貝島太市に嫁する）
sen.e: Younger sister: Fuji (married to Taichi KAIZIMA, an entrepreneur, in Fukuoka Prefecture)

sen.e: Wife: Miyo (the eldest daughter of Jiro IDA, an entrepreneur and the founder of Takashimaya Co., Ltd., in Kyoto Prefecture)

sen.j: 長男：鮎川弥一（実業家）
sen.e: Eldest son: Yaichi AYUKAWA (an entrepreneur)
Eldest son: Yaichi AYUKAWA (an entrepreneur)
Eldest son: Yaichi AYUKAWA (an entrepreneur)

sen.j: 中小企業助成会は長男弥一の代にベンチャービジネス向けの投資会社「テクノベンチャー」に改組している。
sen.e: The Small and Medium-Sized Firms Assistance Association was reorganized into "Techno Venture," an investment company for venture businesses in the generation of the eldest son, Yaichi.
The Small and Medium-Sized Firms Assistance Association was reorganized into "Techno Venture," an investment company for venture businesses in the generation of the eldest son, Yaichi.
